answers.answer: Oh my! That's a horrible one! My daughter took my g/daughter to St. Lucia  in the summer to see her father. I thought she was making up this silly name for an illness and even asked her if you get it from chickens? how ignorant was I! Daughter came home to UK with it and invited friends back- who all became ill in UK! So, so ill. We are white English and have never heard of it. So, I went on to the St. Lucia site to find out exactly what it is.  They were so helpful so I suggest you go on a site like that, I don't know where you are, and explain where you are and ask for their help in how you get that help wherever you are living. That is one horrible illness and does take ages before you feel OK. I answered your question because I actually saw this dreadful thing in the summer. I hope this has been of some help.

question: My aunt as been experiencing some slow reflex action and her body jumps sometimes (nerves moving in certain parts of her body).She is in her early fifties. She barely walks and stand on her own. She has been to neurologists and they have tested her and the results show that her nerves are ok. So I don't know what the problem is, please help us because she is in pain. It as gotten worse since she got chikungunya. Her knees also hurts her. She doesn't have diabetes, heart problem or high blood pressure. She has asthma as well.
title: Muscle Twiching
